subject: Soccer
lead_paragraph: Tina DiMartino scored her first senior international goal Wednesday to help the defending champion United States beat Denmark, 2-0, in the Algarve Cup in Lagos, Portugal. DiMartino, making her second appearance, knocked in the ball from short range in the 35th minute after Natasha Kai’s header rebounded off the post. Angie Woznuk scored the first goal for the Americans in the 22nd minute. The United States beat Denmark in the last two finals and has won the title six times in the last eight years. algarve ¶Manchester United goalkeeper Edwin van der Sar had his English league record of not allowing a goal stopped at 1,311 minutes after he failed to hold a shot and Peter Lovenkrands gave Newcastle the lead. The Red Devils rallied for a 2-1 victory. goalie.
